meanings.definition: Having greater power, influence, or importance than others.
meanings.sent1: The red color was predominant in the painting.
meanings.sent2: Her predominant role in the group made her a natural leader.
meanings.sent3: The cat's predominant meow was so loud, it woke up the whole house.
meanings.sent4: In the jungle, the lion is the predominant ruler of the animal kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The storm's predominant winds blew down trees and power lines.

meanings.sent1: The predominant flavor in the soup was garlic.
meanings.sent2: Wearing jeans is the predominant fashion choice among teenagers.
meanings.sent3: The predominant topic of conversation at the party was the latest movie.
meanings.sent4: In the garden, the rose is the predominant flower, blooming in every corner.
meanings.sent5: The predominant sound in the forest was the chirping of birds.
